USA.title: Studying in the USA
USA.description: The USA is a global educational hub with over 4,000 institutions offering a wide variety of courses. It is known for high-quality education, research opportunities, and a vibrant student life.
whyChoose: World-renowned universities with flexible study options.
Advanced research facilities and cutting-edge technology.
Excellent career prospects with post-graduation job opportunities.

faqs.question: Can Indian students study in the USA?
faqs.answer: Yes, provided they meet eligibility and admission criteria.

faqs.question: Can students work while studying?
faqs.answer: Yes, up to 20 hours per week on campus.

faqs.question: What are the accommodation options?
faqs.answer: On-campus dorms, shared apartments, and homestays.

faqs.question: Is IELTS compulsory?
faqs.answer: No, alternatives like TOEFL and PTE Academic are accepted.

UK.title: Studying in the UK
UK.description: The UK is home to some of the world's top universities and provides students with globally recognized degrees. The education system emphasizes research, practical knowledge, and critical thinking.
whyChoose: Home to prestigious universities like Oxford and Cambridge.
Shorter duration for degrees compared to other countries.
Diverse culture and strong industry connections.

faqs.question: Can I work while studying?
faqs.answer: Yes, students can work up to 20 hours per week.

faqs.question: Is the UK degree recognized globally?
faqs.answer: Yes, UK degrees are highly valued worldwide.

faqs.question: Can I stay after my studies?
faqs.answer: Yes, the UK offers a post-study work visa.

Canada.title: Studying in Canada
Canada.description: Canada is one of the safest and most affordable study destinations, known for its high-quality education, multicultural environment, and post-study work opportunities.
whyChoose: Affordable tuition fees compared to other top destinations.
Opportunity to gain Canadian permanent residency after studies.
Excellent quality of life and research opportunities.

faqs.question: Can I work while studying in Canada?
faqs.answer: Yes, students can work up to 20 hours per week.

faqs.question: Is IELTS mandatory?
faqs.answer: Yes, IELTS or TOEFL is required for most universities.

Australia.title: Studying in Australia
Australia.description: Australia is home to top-ranking universities, offering research-based learning and strong job opportunities post-graduation.
whyChoose: High standard of living with excellent healthcare and safety.
Post-study work visas available.
Globally recognized degrees with strong research focus.

faqs.question: Can I stay in Australia after my studies?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can apply for a post-study work visa.

Germany.title: Studying in Germany
Germany.description: Germany is a great destination for international students due to its high-quality education system and low or no tuition fees at public universities.
whyChoose: Most public universities offer free education.
Strong research opportunities in engineering and sciences.
Vibrant student life with cultural diversity.

faqs.question: Do I need to know German?
faqs.answer: Yes, most courses require German proficiency.

France.title: Studying in France
France.description: France offers world-class education with affordable tuition fees, making it one of the top destinations for students worldwide.
whyChoose: Affordable tuition fees compared to other European countries.
Home to globally recognized business and fashion schools.
Rich culture and student-friendly cities.

New Zealand.title: Studying in New Zealand
New Zealand.description: New Zealand provides top-tier education, work opportunities, and a safe environment for students.
whyChoose: Work-friendly policies for international students.
Affordable tuition fees and cost of living.
High-quality education and research opportunities.
